title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 345.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 345.2 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) Applicant means
an individual to whom past-due spousal support or spousal and child support is
owed, and who applies for services under this Part. (b) Certification means the annual request by
the department, to the New York State Department of Taxation and Finance, for
the offset of tax refunds otherwise due to delinquent payors of child and/or
spousal support. (c) Money judgment
means a certified copy of a court order for a sum certain for arrears accrued
under an order of support directing the entry of a money judgment; provided, however, that such order has been filed in the office of the clerk in the
county in which the proceeding was commenced. (d) Order of support means any temporary or
final order, judgment or decree in a matrimonial action or family court
proceeding, or any foreign support order, judgment or decree, registered
pursuant to section 37-a of the Domestic Relations Law, which directs the
payment of alimony, maintenance, spousal support or child support. (e) Respondent means an individual, estate or
trust who is alleged to owe past-due court ordered child and/or spousal
support. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
ยง
345.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
